>>Weather Salamanca

The climate is warm and temperate in Salamanca. The rain in Salamanca falls mostly in the winter, with relatively little rain in the summer. According to Köppen and Geiger, this climate is classified as Csa. The mean yearly temperature observed in Salamanca is recorded to be 12.5 °C | 54.5 °F. In a year, the rainfall is 486 mm | 19.1 inch.

The given location is in the northern hemisphere. -> The particular spot is situated in the upper half of the planet. Summer begins at the end of June and ends in September. The months of summer are: June, July, August, September.

Climate graph // Weather by Month Salamanca

The driest month is July, with 13 mm | 0.5 inch of rainfall. In October, the precipitation reaches its peak, with an average of 65 mm | 2.6 inch.

average temperature by month Salamanca

The warmest month of the year is July, with an average temperature of 22.4 °C | 72.3 °F. At 4.1 °C | 39.4 °F on average, January is the coldest month of the year.

The difference in precipitation between the driest month and the wettest month is 52 mm | 2 inch. The variation in annual temperature is around 18.3 °C | 32.9 °F.

The month with the most relative humidity is January (82.90 %). The month with the least relative humidity is July (40.93 %). The wettest month is April (10.57 days), while the driest is July (2.87).

avg. hours of sun

Total hours of sun

The month with the most daily hours of sunshine in Salamanca is July, averaging 12.51 hours of sunshine. In total, there are 387.87 hours of sunshine throughout July.

In Salamanca, the month that experiences the least amount of daily sunshine is January. On average, there are only about 4.43 hours of sunlight per day during this time. The total number of sunlit hours in a typical January amounts to approximately 137.19.

In Salamanca, the yearly sum of sunshine is estimated to be around 2981.34 hours. On average, this equates to a monthly figure of approximately 97.84 hours for each month.
